reviews.sentence: Good hotel. Stayed there for three days in December 2014 Reception gave me an internal connected room. When tried to change they told me the hotel is full. finally a reception female agent who was so kind and helpful changed my room to a room with two twin beds. Room was fine as the bed was ok and comfortable anyway. View was a nice specially on a new high floor. When asked for charger no one assisted and the answer I got from operator is to go down to reception so they can charge my mobile there. Main restaurant was a very nice restaurant to dine at the restaurant manager is one of the best as well as his staff are well trained very helpful and professional. Food was not nice at dinner Cesar salad or beef tenderloin. Lettuce was not cuted and instead full leaves with dressing on top Asked for well done tenderloin received it medium rare. Breakfast buffet was delicious. Concierge Bellmen or doormen were very friendly. Overall the hotel was a very good pace to stay at however service needs to be improved little bit.

was Ok but not for the price. Arrived in a car no one available for bags. Had to wait 10 minutes to find someone. On a long weekend. Front desk unpleasant attitude. Indifferent. Asked questions about the reservation in a backward way. Instead of asking for the booking number went by last name. Had a hard time to find that way. Restaurant one staff member took order for drinks brought the wrong beer had to return it. Waste of money loss for hotel. Otherwise food was acceptable and reasonable. Gift shop extremely stuffy hot humid. Unpleasant to stay there and buy anything. Room on first night was cleaned quickly. next day had to wait until 4 0 PM for the room to be cleaned. had to call housekeeping and push them. housekeeping left dirty rag in room did not come to pick it up. Threw it out on floor that evening was there the next day. The bed and room was clean size was Ok. bathrooms a little small for even 1 person. Self parking price is reasonable. Not reasonable is the 995 per day for wifi. This should be changed. Other than this hotel is very nice.

What happened to this place. let us just say that when you stay here twice a year for 20 years and you see this place modernize and offer good services throughout the years it is disappointing that you reserve for just one night on the way out of Toronto to find yourself in Room 106. it is s 2 Queen room where the phone near the bed does not work and the staff at the front desk ask you to use the bathroom phone to make calls or you have to wait for maintenance at 1025pm. It is a room where the shampoo and body wash are nowhere to be found and they have to send a staff member with it in bagies to your door. It is a room with 2 grey stains on the white cover of the bed on the right. And above all it is a room with dirty used toilet paper stuck inside the supposedly cleaned toilet. Oh and did I mention the 149tax for one night price tag. It seems that Starwod Gold Preferred guests get this treatment. So I shudder to think what regular clients receive. At the end of the day Yuri the manager came to observe and strike a deal to switch rooms free breakfast and no charge. after I insisted. Because that room was a disgusting shame for a hotel of this calibre. Just so grossed out at the toilet paper in the toilet thing that for me staying here again is doubtful. Caveat emptor.

Typical middle upper end chain hotel. Stayed here with family for 4 nights for a wedding nearby. Great location for where we wanted to be but otherwise a bit of a desert unles you like the dozens of fast food and takeaway outlets over the road. Had problems checking in as their system was down for 30 minutes but eventually checked us in to one of our three rooms manually. Thoughtfully they put the entire group on the same floor. The events organiser who set up the rooms for us several months ago was very helpful but I got a very indifferent welcome from the front desk when I called in the day before to confirm the reservations. Rooms were clean and had all you would expect including a separate walk in shower. Chambermaid was very good as was the concierge. Parking was extra which seems excessive given we took 4 rooms for 34 nights. Bar staff were very helpful but ate breakfast over the road at Coras. Reservation said 3 pm checkout for one of our groups on Sunday but front desk insisted on a 12 noon checkout which seemed unnecessary. Pool area is ok but a bit spartan.

Stuck in 1985. In terms of cleanliness I give the rooms a 4 out of 5. Now where it falls short are two particular categories. The service was particularly slow for a check in at 11 pm I waited about 25 minutes to be serviced. Not that there was a long line and there was less staff but just a very slow procedure. The second shortfall is sadly the hotel itself. I felt that the decor was very 80s not that that takes away from the quality of the stay but the aesthetic appeal was sorely affected. In our room there were areas where the paint was stripping or where things were falling apart but none the less the bed was quite comfortable if that is a saving grace.

I have travelled to many places I have stayed at many different price ranges and quality hotels this hotel by far has to be the worst. Upon arrival we parked out front to unload our luggage we did not receive a hello or a would you like me to assist you. We got absolutely nothing. We made a mistake while booking our room and instead of putting four adults we put three and when we arrived they out us in a room with only one bed. I seen that there was a fridge in the room so i opened it and it was full of their overly expensive drinks. There was a fridge magnet attached to the fridge that basically said if you take any of these items you will be charged. But if you need a personal fridge call 0. I called 0 and i simply asked for a fridge and the lady said they ran out now that is not bad ill get over not having a fridge but what takes place is worse. We go down to the front desk to ask them about the parking situation and they are charging us 12 to park in their parking lot for their guests. So we accepted that and moved on and i asked them if we could be moved to a different room to accommodate the extra person. They said all the rooms were full which made sense but then we asked for a cot or anything spare we could use to sleep on and they had nothing how does a massive overly priced hotel not have enough equipment to function. So now we have no cot no fridge and are paying to park but what gets worse is we called to see if they have a extra 2 or 3 blankets to make a bed on the FLOOR but nope did not have any blankets in a massive hotel. I have had an awful experience. For the next 3 nights my buddy has to sleep on the floor with one small sheet and a small pillow my other buddys in the small cardboard like arm chair. And i sleep in the stiff uncomfortable bed and we have to rotate every night. I will NEVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE even my worst enemy. I have plenty of experience with traveling and this would be the last place i would choose. They charge massive amounts of money for everything and they treated us like complete dirt like outsiders. Other people were walking around getting treated like royalty because they were older and richer looking. We were not treated like a human being this entire stay NEVER EVER COME HERE I PROMISE you will RUIN YOUR WHOLE VACATION. and I am not just saying this because I am mad or heated this is pure truth.

Good location. This hotel was suitably located for me in North York. It is a nice hotel and we had a good view of the city. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful but the checkin process leaves room for improvement. Our room booking included the buffet breakfast but we did not get our breakfast coupons until the next morning when I went to the front desk to ask about it. The coupons were actually sitting in an envelope with my name on it waiting in the reception drawer. Luckily I am a regular traveler so I was aware of the need for those coupons before going for breakfast. The buffet breakfast is delicious and there is enough variety if you plan to stay for a few days. We had one incident where the waiter told my husband he was not entitled to the hot items in the buffet but apologized later for his mistake when I arrived. Luckily we are very forgiving people because this was a major embarrassment for any guest. The hotel has a couple of restaurants but we did not try them. Wifi is free for SPG members who book on the SPG site. There are quite a few eating places within walking distance. Tim Hortons is on the same side which we liked. And across the street is Five Guys Burgers and a few other places. We enjoy Caribbean cuisine when we visit Toronto so we ate at other restaurants further out. This hotel is also located on the bus route that takes you to York Mills subway station. From this station we were able to get to Union Station without transferring and to the waterfront and downtown Toronto. If you are an SPG member you have to ensure that all the points are credited to your account after your stay because they do forget to credit the points for the Green program which is an excellent program. All in all we enjoyed our stay here.

AC unit is our room made a loud noise. Air con unit in our room made a constant buzzing noise and then woke us up at 3 am with a loud grinding noise. Hot tub closed staff too busy to really be helpful. We have stayed at many Westin Hotels but this was very disappointing. Would not stay at this location again.

Bit of a hike from downtown but a nice property. We stayed at the Westin with a group in July and overall were pleased with the experience. The event we were there for was near the hotel so we stayed there but if you are looking to spend time downtown be aware that it is about a 30 minute40 ride. The hotel is nice and modern and the rooms are spacious although we were upgraded the little balconies are a nice touch as well. If you are coming with a group give the bar a heads up so they can staff up. The 2 poor bartenders were a bit overwhelmed when 20 of us showed up en masse.

Some Imperfections but Great Hotel Great Property. Despite some of their imperfections Westin Prince was a good choice. What they are lacking they managed to make up in other areas. I had a first good impression as I entered the lobby inviting a pleasant aroma. A chic looking lounge bar restaurant as well as an internet lounge and a convenience shop all on the main floor. The property ground is picturesque beautiful forest like with lovely trees and gardens and walking path. Occupied a two queen bed no pull out sofa good enough for a small family parking street view TV small fridge no microwave but requested one with no problem coffee maker self parking with a daily rate complimentary wi fi kid family friendly hotel tennis court basketball court nice outdoor pool fitness centre indoor hot tub kids allowed with supervision internet lounge business centre. Used the fitness centre several times and was quite happy with the facilities and my workout. The room humid in the room carpet had a damp smell separate stand up shower was not comfortable too tight of a space no elbow room. Internet worked well no issues. The games room has no games just a ping pong table. You borrow a racquet and ball from the front desk. They gave me a golf ball to play ping pong with. For most part staff were pleasant professional service minded. The grounds and amenities lovely. The floors a bit run down noticed a damp smell from floor to florFitnes Centre 24hours 4 treadmills 2 stationary bike 3 elipticals free weights strength training machine exercise balls mat not enough floor space for stretching. Great location easy access to highways everything you need is close by shops at Don Mills and Fairview Mall just 10 minutes away gas stations popular restaurants and fast foods are near by. Three restaurants in the hotel japanese iranian Lounge 90On the last day I found a parking ticket on my windshield even though my vehicles plate was registered at the front desk at check in and they were already charging my credit card a daily rate. it was voided after I brought it up with the front desk. Despite a few blunder with room service and some hotel imperfections I would come back to Westin Prince.

Very nice stay. I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference in the area. The hotel itself exceeded my expectations. It was a very nice clean hotel with great dining options. My room was clean the bathroom was clean and the staff was very helpful throughout. It was about a 20 minute drive into downtown. I had an incident where I burned my finger. While the staff was very helpful in getting me ice it would be nice for the hotel to carry some basic first aid supplies for a small incident like mine. That would be my only recommendation. Other than that great hotel.

Great Customer Service Overcomes All. Stayed at the property as part of conference. Even though I arrived long before check in time the front desk staff got me a room. Room service was swift although typical hotel overpriced. My lunch arrived within 20 minutes of order and the food was hot and plentiful. On the 2nd day of my stay discovered that i could not receive any incoming calls. My maintenance man Mani was quick to diagnose that one of the phone lines had been cut by the group doing street repairs. MANI was extremely apologetic and offered to have my room moved. When I told him that this was unnecessary since I only had night left he promised some sort of compensation for my inconvenience. later in the day Mani showed up with a comp breakfast certificate and later the manager Krisandrasent me a handwritten note and chocolates. further apologizing. Problems aside this is a great hotel with great food and service. I highly recommend.
Top shelf service. Fantastic. Top rate service. Would stay again and again.

lovely modern hotel with good amenities. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Got a good rate by calling the hotel directly. Unfortunately they did not tell me that parking was not included in the rate. Since the hotel is not near an airport or any other major form of transportation I would guess that most guests have their own vehicles and having to pay for parking would be something they could have informed me about when making my reservation. Beyond that hotel is lovely and staff attentive. Food in the Restaurant Lobby Bar was excellent. Staff in the Lobby Bar were very nice. Food plaza across the street was sort of handy. Doing business in the area so location was ideal could not open slider in my room on the 11th floor even just a bit for some fresh air. Floor to ceiling corner windows are very nice.

2nd Property Review Improved. Traveled to the GTA on business again and decided to give this hotel another try. Was greeted on arrival by friendly associates at the front desk who were attentive. Much to my surprise I provided a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor. The bathroom appeared to be the only area of the room that had been remodeled but the changes were nice. Hans Groh bath fixtures throughout with a rain shower shower head made for a luxurious shower experience. Bath amenities were run of the mill nothing spectacular. The remainder of the room appeared as others I have stayed in at this property wallpaper coming off the wall in places desk and wardrobe are fairly old and worn. Hopefully these will be replaced as a part of their remodel plans. Common areas of the hotel are spectacular and are what can be expected of a Westin property. One disappointment again is the pace of service in the bar on the lobby level. SLOW beyond belief. Sat for 10 minutes not acknowledged even though a server walked by several time. Finally decided to just stand and order pay immediately and take it to my room. Takes forever to get the check. Always seem to be out of Stella Artois and other beers on tap or something is wrong with the tap or some other excuse. Breakfast buffet in the mornings is very good and offers both healthy and alternate options. All delicious. Service in the restaurant is consistent with Westins high standards. Checkout is quick and efficient. The lifts elevators are slow and directional arrows evidently do not work on all floors as guests wanting to go down were hopping on not realizing it was going the opposite direction. Some mentioned the arrows were not working.

Badly in need of renovations not up to Westin Standards. I am a lifetime SPG member with close to 300 lifetime nights so I am a loyal Westin customer. I have stayed at Westins all over North America and the Prince is simply not up to standards. The hallways and rooms badly need renovation. The carpeting in the hallway was buckling everywhere and the carpet in my room was very worn out. The windows 14th floor. I can only describe as filthy. You had to keep the sheers closed the entire time. The balcony which was closed off has chipped concrete all around it and was an eyesore. I stayed there for 11 nights and need a refrigerator for medications. I either called or e mailed the hotel three times to confirm a refrigerator would be in the room and received this within 24 hours of my arivalThank you for contacting Starwod Customer Service regarding your upcoming stay. I will be happy to take care of this for you. Mr XXX I have just spoken to the front desk of the hotel. They have updated the reservation to include the refrigerator. They told me that it will not be a problem and look forward to your arrival. I arrived at 1030 pm after 12 hours of travel and there was no refrigerator and the staff said nothing could be done that evening. I had to pack my medications in ice all night. To their credit they did get me a fridge the next day but I predicated my entire stay at this hotel on having a fridge in the room. The staff is generally helpful and friendly and the restaurants are good. However I doubt that I would stay here again simply due to the poor condition that the hotel is in.
Excellent facilities and staff.
nice room clean convenient friendly staff comfortable and not expensivehighly recommended.
Service was very prompt and friendly. The hotel was clean and staff was very knowledgeable of the area.

Came to Toronto for a wedding. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful and even upgraded our room with complimentary snacks after a long morning of traveling for no extra cost. Room service was timely and the food was good. Would recommend.

Good environment unprofessional staff. Very good environment large space good location. Unprofessional staff. I booked a luxury twin beds room and paid on booking but first time I got a luxury one bed room then I go to the counter to change the lady said they do not have any luxury room anymore and I should either move or stay in that room. I was some annoyed by her words then she apologized and gave me a lower level room. Might due to my question about the room type the lady just told me that the new room rate is lower than I booked and I can have some money back. I will say their staff can make mistakes everywhere. Seems they will not tell you the rate is changed if you do not ask.

A bit dated but GREAT service great views on higher floor and excellent location. We enjoyed our stay at this property. I agree with some of the other reviews in that the property is a bit dated but overall we had a great experience. We were arriving during a wedding ceremony reception at the hotel that evening and there were a number of people trying to check in. They handled us promptly with a smile and were authentic in their friendly service. We had a room on one of the higher floors with a fantastic view. Very nice. Bed was very comfortable. We had an excellent nights sleep. Room was quiet no outside noise. Parking is easy and accessible. If staying in the Toronto area this property is close an easy drive to restaurants shopping and more without paying twice maybe three times. the price as you would downtown. Highly recommend.
Very clean rooms and friendly staff.
Good location great beds and linen nice staff parking needs attention.
Very nice hotel friendly staff. home like atmosphere.
